intro: Steinmannia graminifolia, commonly known as the grass-like bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its flowering period occurs in the spring and early summer, making it a notable species in its native habitat.
